subsection.def: annual consolidated financial statements (周年綜合財務報表) means the consolidated statements required to be prepared under section 379(2) of the Ordinance;
annual financial statements (周年財務報表) means the statements required to be prepared under section 379(1) of the Ordinance;
auditor’s report (核數師報告) means the report required to be prepared under section 405 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report required to be prepared under section 388(1) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the consolidated report required to be prepared under section 388(2) of the Ordinance;

subsection.def: Disclosure Regulation (《披露規例》) means regulations made under sections 451 and 452(2) of the Ordinance;
financial statements (財務報表) means annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements;
potential member (潛在成員), in relation to a company, means a person who is entitled, whether conditionally or unconditionally, to become a member of the company;
subsidiary undertaking (附屬企業) has the same meaning as in Part 9 of the Ordinance; (35 of 2018 s. 100)
summary financial report (財務摘要報告) means a financial report prepared under section 439 of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, a reference to the reporting documents for a financial year is a reference to all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial statements for the financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the directors’ report for the financial year;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the auditor’s report on those financial statements.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Form and contents of summary financial report: general

subsection.content: A summary financial report for a financial year of a company must contain the information derived from the reporting documents for the financial year of the company.
A summary financial report for a financial year of a company must contain the information and particulars set out in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The information and particulars referred to in subsection (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: all the information and particulars included in the following statements of the company relating to the financial year—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: statement of financial position; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: statement of comprehensive income;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the company is a holding company, all the information and particulars included in the following statements of the company relating to the financial year—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: consolidated statement of financial position; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: consolidated statement of comprehensive income;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the company’s reporting documents for the financial year include a separate income statement in addition to the company’s statement of comprehensive income, all the information and particulars included in the income statement;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the company is a holding company and its reporting documents for the financial year include a separate consolidated income statement in addition to the company’s consolidated statement of comprehensive income, all the information and particulars included in the consolidated income statement; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: included in the directors’ report of the company for the financial year as required under—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: sections 388 and 390 of the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the Companies (Directors’ Report) Regulation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: contained in the notes to the financial statements for the financial year as prescribed by the Disclosure Regulation. (L.N. 48 of 2013)

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a holding company is to be construed in accordance with section 357(4)(b) of the Ordinance. (35 of 2018 s. 101)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Form and contents of summary financial report: auditor’s report and opinion

subsection.leadIn: A summary financial report for a financial year of a company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contain a statement from the company’s auditor as to whether the auditor’s report for that financial year is qualified or otherwise modified, or includes a reference to any matter to which the auditor drew attention by way of emphasis without qualifying the report; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the auditor’s report is qualified or otherwise modified, set out the full auditor’s report and any further material necessary for the understanding of the qualification or other modification.

subsection.leadIn: If the auditor’s report of a company contains a statement that, in the auditor’s opinion, the financial statements for a financial year of the company have not been properly prepared in compliance with the Ordinance, and in particular—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a true and fair view of the financial position and financial performance of the company has not been given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a company that is required to prepare annual consolidated financial statements, a true and fair view of the financial position and financial performance of the company, and all the subsidiary undertakings, as a whole has not been given,

subsection.continued: a summary financial report for that financial year must contain that statement.

subsection.content: If the auditor’s report of a company contains a statement that, in the auditor’s opinion, the information in a directors’ report for a financial year is not consistent with the financial statements for the financial year, a summary financial report for that financial year must contain that statement.

subsection.leadIn: If the auditor’s report for a financial year of a company contains—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a statement that, in the auditor’s opinion—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: adequate accounting records have not been kept by the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the company’s financial statements are not in agreement with its accounting records in any material respect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement that the auditor has failed to obtain all the information or explanations that, to the best of the auditor’s knowledge and belief, are necessary and material for the purpose of the audit; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a statement giving the particulars that are required to be, but have not been, contained in the financial statements, as required by section 407(4) of the Ordinance,

subsection.continued: a summary financial report for that financial year must contain those statements.

subsection.leadIn: A summary financial report of a company must contain an opinion from the company’s auditor as to whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report is consistent with the reporting documents from which the report is derived; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the report complies with the requirements of this Part.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Form and contents of summary financial report: other matters

subsection.leadIn: If a company is not required to prepare annual consolidated financial statements, a summary financial report of the company must contain, in a prominent position (but not necessarily on the front cover) of the report, a statement to the effect that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report only gives a summary of the information and particulars contained in the reporting documents of the company from which the report is derived; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the company may obtain from the company free of charge a copy of the reporting documents if a request is made on or before the specified date.

subsection.leadIn: If a company is required to prepare annual consolidated financial statements, a summary financial report of the company must contain, in a prominent position (but not necessarily on the front cover) of the report, a statement to the effect that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report only gives a summary of the information and particulars contained in the reporting documents of the company, and its subsidiary undertakings, from which the report is derived; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the company may obtain from the company free of charge a copy of the reporting documents if a request is made on or before the specified date.

subsection.content: A summary financial report for a financial year of a company must contain, in a prominent position (but not necessarily on the front cover) of the report, a statement about how a member of the company may obtain from the company free of charge a copy of the reporting documents from which the report is derived.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not prohibit a company from including in its summary financial report for a financial year any other information or particulars which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company considers appropriate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not inconsistent with the reporting documents of the company for the financial year from which the report is derived.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a company is required to hold an annual general meeting in accordance with section 610 of the Ordinance in respect of a financial year, means the day immediately before the expiry of a period of 6 months after the date of the annual general meeting on which a copy of the reporting documents is to be laid;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a copy of the reporting documents is laid at a general meeting subsequent to an annual general meeting, means the day immediately before the expiry of a period of 6 months after the date of the subsequent meeting; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if, by virtue of section 612(2) of the Ordinance, a company is not required to hold an annual general meeting in accordance with section 610 of the Ordinance in respect of a financial year, means the day immediately before the expiry of a period of 6 months after the date on which a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year is sent under section 430(3) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Other requirements in relation to form of summary financial report
section.content: Subject to this Regulation, a company may specify any other requirements in relation to the form of its summary financial report that the company considers appropriate.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Notification and Notice of Intent, etc.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Form and contents of notification for seeking member’s intent on receiving summary financial report

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 442(2) of the Ordinance, the notification to be sent by a company to a member or potential member must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the financial year to which the notification relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include a general statement about the contents and function of a summary financial report.

subsection.content: The notification must contain the statements set out in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The statements referred to in subsection (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement to the effect that a summary financial report only gives a summary of the information and particulars contained in the reporting documents from which the report is derived;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a statement to the effect that the person to whom the notification is addressed may send a notice of intent to the company informing the company as to whether—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the person wishes to receive from the company a copy of the reporting documents—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in hard copy form; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: (if the company has given an option to request the copy to be sent in electronic form or by making it available on a website) in electronic form or by making it available on the company’s website;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the person wishes to receive from the company, instead of a copy of the reporting documents, a copy of the summary financial report—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in hard copy form; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: (if the company has given an option to request the copy to be sent in electronic form or by making it available on a website) in electronic form or by making it available on the company’s website; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the person does not wish to receive a copy of the reporting documents or a copy of the summary financial report at all;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a statement to the effect that a notice of intent may be in the form and sent in the manner that is specified in the notification; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a statement to the effect that if a notice of intent is to have effect in relation to the financial year to which the notification relates, the card or document mentioned in section 10 must be received by the company at least 28 days before the specified date.

subsection.leadIn: The notification must contain a statement about the effect of a notice of intent for a financial year, that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the notice of intent is received by the company at least 28 days before the specified date, the notice of intent has effect in relation to that financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it ceases to have effect under section 442(7) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the notice of intent is received by the company less than 28 days before the specified date—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the notice of intent has effect in relation to every financial year subsequent to that financial year until it ceases to have effect under section 442(7) of the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the member or potential member who gives the notice of intent is to be regarded as—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: having requested a copy of the summary financial report for the financial year; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: having requested the copy of the report to be sent by the company in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if a member or potential member does not give the company a notice of intent in response to the notification before the specified date, the member or potential member is to be regarded as—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: having requested a copy of the summary financial report for the financial year and every subsequent financial year; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: having requested the copy of the report to be sent by the company in hard copy form,

paragraph.continued: until the statutory election ceases to have effect under section 442(9) of the Ordinance.

subsection.def: specified date (指明日期) means the first date on which a copy of the reporting documents for a financial year is sent to a member under section 430 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Additional provisions as to contents of notification under section 7

subsection.content: The notification under section 7 must contain a statement specifying the matters referred to in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The matters referred to in subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of intent may be revoked by giving the company a written notice of revocation under section 442(7)(b) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars of the notice of revocation required under section 443(1), (2) and (4) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the effect of the notice of revocation in relation to the financial year to which it relates, that is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the notice of revocation is received by the company at least 28 days before the specified date, the notice has effect in relation to that financial year, and every subsequent financial year;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the notice of revocation is received by the company less than 28 days before the specified date, the notice has effect in relation to every financial year subsequent to that financial year;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if a notice of intent is not given to the company before the date specified in section 442(8) of the Ordinance, a written notice of cessation of statutory election may be given to the company under section 442(9)(b) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the particulars of the notice of cessation of statutory election required under section 443(3) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the effect of the notice of cessation of statutory election in relation to the financial year to which it relates, that is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the notice of cessation of statutory election is received by the company at least 28 days before the specified date, the notice has effect in relation to that financial year, and every subsequent financial year;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the notice of cessation of statutory election is received by the company less than 28 days before the specified date, the notice has effect in relation to every financial year subsequent to that financial year.

subsection.def: specified date (指明日期) means the first date on which a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year to which a notice of revocation or a notice of cessation of statutory election (as the case may be) relates is sent to a member under section 430 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Company may include other information in notification
section.content: Sections 7 and 8 do not prohibit a company from including in its notification any other information that the company considers appropriate.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Notification attached with card or document
section.content: A notification under section 7 must have attached to it a card or document that may be used by a member or potential member for the purposes of sending a notice of intent to the company.

subsection.leadIn: The card or document mentioned in section 10 must be provided with postage prepaid that is sufficient to enable a member or potential member to use it for sending in Hong Kong a notice of intent to the company without having to pay the relevant postage fee if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notification under section 7 is in paper form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the member or potential member to which the notification is to be sent is an address in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), the company is not required to pay the postage in respect of the return of the card or document if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the address of a member to which a notification is sent, in accordance with the company’s articles, is not in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of a potential member to which a notification is sent, in accordance with the contractual provisions under which the potential member is entitled, whether conditionally or unconditionally, to become a member, is not in Hong Kong.
